meanings.definition: A person who serves drinks from a tap.
meanings.sent1: The tapster poured a cold glass of lemonade for the customer.
meanings.sent2: The tapster behind the bar quickly served up pints of beer to the thirsty patrons.
meanings.sent3: The tapster accidentally spilled a bit of soda while pouring a fizzy drink.
meanings.sent4: She was a tapster of emotions, carefully dispensing empathy to those in need.
meanings.sent5: The tapster's skillful hands swiftly filled each glass with the perfect amount of ale.

meanings.definition: To dispense drinks from a tap.
meanings.sent1: He will tapster the keg to provide fresh beer for the party.
meanings.sent2: The bartender tapsters the cider into the waiting glass with precision.
meanings.sent3: She tapstered the soda into the cup, creating a refreshing drink for the customer.
meanings.sent4: The rain tapstered down from the sky, quenching the dry earth below.
meanings.sent5: The music tapstered out of the speakers, filling the room with lively tunes.
